Data Structures | Macros | Typedefs | Enumerations | Functions | Variables
UART Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter) hardware abstraction for Apollo5 devices. It supports UART configuration, data transfer, interrupt handling, and DMA operations for serial communication applications.

Key Features

  1. UART Configuration: Flexible baud rate and parameter configuration.
  2. Data Transfer: Support for blocking and non-blocking data transfer.
  3. DMA Support: High-speed DMA-based data transfer operations.
  4. Interrupt Handling: Comprehensive interrupt management for UART events.
  5. FIFO Management: Advanced FIFO handling and buffer management.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure UART peripheral
  • Handle data transfer operations (blocking/non-blocking)
  • Support DMA-based high-speed transfers
  • Manage FIFO buffers and data flow
  • Handle UART interrupts and status monitoring

Usage

  1. Initialize UART using am_hal_uart_initialize()
  2. Configure UART parameters and baud rate
  3. Set up DMA or interrupt handling as needed
  4. Perform data transfer operations
  5. Handle UART events and status monitoring

Configuration

  • Baud Rate: Configure UART baud rate and timing
  • Data Format: Set up data bits, parity, and stop bits
  • DMA Settings: Configure DMA transfer parameters
  • Interrupts: Set up interrupt sources and handlers

UART Flag Register

Macro definitions for UART Flag Register Bits. They may be used with the am_hal_uart_flags_get() function.

◆ am_hal_uart_power_disable

#define am_hal_uart_power_disable ( phandle)    am_hal_uart_power_control(phandle, AM_HAL_SYSCTRL_DEEPSLEEP, false);

UART disable macro.

This will allow the user a more standard function call for disabling the UART If the user wishes to retain the state, use am_hal_uart_power_control(..., true)

Returns
HAL status code.

◆ am_hal_uart_power_enable

◆ BAUDCLK

#define BAUDCLK   (16)

◆ MCUCTRL_D2ASPARE_UART0PLL

#define MCUCTRL_D2ASPARE_UART0PLL   (0x01 << 22)

◆ ONE_BYTE_DELAY

#define ONE_BYTE_DELAY ( pState)
Value:
if (1) \
{ \
uint32_t delayus; \
delayus = 1000000 * 10 / pState->ui32BaudRate; /* Delay for 10 bit (8 bits,start/stop) */ \
delayus += 1; /* Round up */ \
am_hal_delay_us(delayus); \
}

Delay constant.

◆ RETURN_ON_ERROR

#define RETURN_ON_ERROR ( x)
Value:
if ((x) != AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS) \
{ \
return (x); \
};
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS
@ AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS
Definition am_hal_status.h:107

◆ am_hal_uart_transfer_type_e

enum am_hal_uart_transfer_type_e

The type of transfer to execute. This is for the non-streaming (blocking and non-blocking) functions.

For blocking transfers, the CPU will poll until the requested number of bytes have been transferred, or the timeout interval elapses, whichever happens first.

For non-blocking transfers, the CPU will read or write as many bytes as possible immediately, and then the interrupt service routine will handle the rest.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_UART_BLOCKING_WRITE 
AM_HAL_UART_BLOCKING_READ 
AM_HAL_UART_NONBLOCKING_WRITE 
AM_HAL_UART_NONBLOCKING_READ 

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_uart_buffer_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_buffer_configure ( void * pHandle,
uint8_t * pui8TxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32TxBufferSize,
uint8_t * pui8RxBuffer,
uint32_t ui32RxBufferSize )

Initialize the UART internal RX/TX queue.

Parameters
pHandleis a pointer to a UART handle to initialize.
pui8TxBufferis the pointer to buffer with length of ui32TxBufferSize.
ui32TxBufferSizeis the length of Tx buffer.
pui8RxBufferis the pointer to buffer with length of ui32RxBufferSize.
ui32RxBufferSizeis the length of Rx buffer.

This function enables the internal UART queue (FIFO) for UART Tx/Rx. When Tx or Rx Queue are enabled, the UART data is stored internally when UART hardware FIFO is full.

Returns
HAL status code.

◆ am_hal_uart_configure()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_configure ( void * pHandle,
const am_hal_uart_config_t * psConfig )

Used to configure basic UART settings.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
psConfigis a structure of UART configuration options.

This function takes the options from an am_hal_uart_config_t structure, and applies them to the UART referred to by pHandle.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_deinitialize()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_deinitialize ( void * pHandle)

Deinitialize the UART interface.

Parameters
pHandleis a previously initialized UART handle.

This function effectively disables future calls to interact with the UART referred to by Handle. The user may call this function if UART operation is no longer desired.

Returns
HAL status code.

UART DMA full-duplex transfer function.

UART dma full duplex transfer function.

Parameters

This function calls the UART DMA for full-duplex operations.

◆ am_hal_uart_flags_get()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_flags_get ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pui32Flags )

Read the UART flags.

Parameters
pHandleis the UART handle to use.
pui32Flagsis the destination pointer for the UART flags.

The UART hardware provides some information about the state of the physical interface at all times. This function provides a way to read that data directly. Below is a list of all possible UART flags.

These correspond directly to the bits in the UART_FR register.

Parameters

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_disable()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_disable ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ui32IntMask )

Disable interrupts.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
ui32IntMaskis the bitmask of interrupts to disable.

This function disables the UART interrupt(s) given by ui32IntMask. If multiple interrupts need to be disabled, they can be OR'ed together.

Note
This function need not be called for UART FIFO interrupts if the UART buffer service provided by am_hal_uart_buffer_configure() and am_hal_uart_interrupt_service() is already in use. Non-FIFO-related interrupts do require the use of this function.

The full list of interrupts is given by the following:

AM_HAL_UART_INT_OVER_RUN
AM_HAL_UART_INT_BREAK_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_PARITY_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_FRAME_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX_TMOUT
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DSRM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DCDM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_CTSM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TXCMP
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_enable ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ui32IntMask )

Enable interrupts.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
ui32IntMaskis the bitmask of interrupts to enable.

This function enables the UART interrupt(s) given by ui32IntMask. If multiple interrupts are desired, they can be OR'ed together.

Note
This function need not be called for UART FIFO interrupts if the UART buffer service provided by am_hal_uart_buffer_configure() and am_hal_uart_interrupt_service() is already in use. Non-FIFO-related interrupts do require the use of this function.

The full list of interrupts is given by the following:

AM_HAL_UART_INT_OVER_RUN
AM_HAL_UART_INT_BREAK_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_PARITY_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_FRAME_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX_TMOUT
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DSRM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DCDM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_CTSM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TXCMP
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_enable_get()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_enable_get ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pui32IntMask )

Check to see which interrupts are enabled.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
pui32IntMaskis the current set of interrupt enable bits (all bits OR'ed together)

This function checks the UART Interrupt Enable Register to see which UART interrupts are currently enabled. The result will be an interrupt mask with one bit set for each of the currently enabled UART interrupts.

The full set of UART interrupt bits is given by the list below:

AM_HAL_UART_INT_OVER_RUN
AM_HAL_UART_INT_BREAK_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_PARITY_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_FRAME_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX_TMOUT
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DSRM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DCDM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_CTSM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TXCMP
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_service()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_service ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ui32Status )

transfer data between hardware and software queue in the background.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
ui32Statusis the interrupt flag and can be any combination of AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX, AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX_TMOUT, or AM_HAL_UART_INT_TX.

This function should be called from the ISR and then receive/transmit data from/to hardware FIFO.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_status_get ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t * pui32Status,
bool bEnabledOnly )

Read interrupt status.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
pui32Statusis the returned interrupt status (all bits OR'ed together)
bEnabledOnlydetermines whether to read interrupts that were not enabled.

This function reads the status the UART interrupt(s) if bEnabled is true, it will only return the status of the enabled interrupts. Otherwise, it will return the status of all interrupts, enabled or disabled.

The full list of interrupts is given by the following:

AM_HAL_UART_INT_OVER_RUN
AM_HAL_UART_INT_BREAK_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_PARITY_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_FRAME_ERR
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX_TMOUT
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_RX
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DSRM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_DCDM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_CTSM
AM_HAL_UART_INT_TXCMP
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_power_control()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_power_control ( void * pHandle,
uint32_t ePowerState,
bool bRetainState )

Change the power state of the UART module.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.
ePowerStateis the desired power state of the UART.
bRetainStateis a flag to ask the HAL to save UART registers.

This function can be used to switch the power to the UART on or off. If bRetainState is true during a powerdown operation, it will store the UART configuration registers to SRAM, so it can restore them on power-up.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

◆ am_hal_uart_tx_abort()

void am_hal_uart_tx_abort ( void * pHandle)

Abort active uart tx transaction.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.

This function reset uart tx states and abort active tx transaction, it should be called after am_hal_uart_tx_flush.

Returns
HAL status code.

◆ am_hal_uart_tx_flush()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_tx_flush ( void * pHandle)

Wait for the UART TX to become idle.

Parameters
pHandleis the handle for the UART to operate on.

This function waits (polling) for all data in the UART TX FIFO and UART TX buffer (if configured) to be fully sent on the physical UART interface. This is not the most power-efficient way to wait for UART idle, but it can be useful in simpler applications, or where power-efficiency is less important.

Once this function returns, the UART can be safely disabled without interfering with any previous transmissions.

For a more power-efficient way to shut down the UART, check the am_hal_uart_interrupt_service() function.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or applicable UART errors.

Parameters
pUARTState- pointer to the UART internal state.

This function validates.
